delete.description: Deletes the specified attached data network.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: packetCoreControlPlaneName
parameters.description: The name of the packet core control plane.

parameters.name: packetCoreDataPlaneName
parameters.description: The name of the packet core data plane.

parameters.name: attachedDataNetworkName
parameters.description: The name of the attached data network.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

200.description: Delete successful.

202.description: Accepted. Sets 'Deleting' provisioningState until the operation completes. Returns an operation URI that can be queried to find the current state of the operation.

204.description: Request successful. Resource does not exist.

get.description: Gets information about the specified attached data network.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: packetCoreControlPlaneName
parameters.description: The name of the packet core control plane.

parameters.name: packetCoreDataPlaneName
parameters.description: The name of the packet core data plane.

parameters.name: attachedDataNetworkName
parameters.description: The name of the attached data network.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting attached data network resource.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the attached data network resource.

userPlaneDataInterface.description: The user plane interface on the data network. For 5G networks, this is the N6 interface. For 4G networks, this is the SGi interface.

name.description: The logical name for this interface. This should match one of the interfaces configured on your Azure Stack Edge device.

vlanId.description: VLAN identifier of the network interface. Example: 501.

ipv4AddressList.description: The list of IPv4 addresses, for a multi-node system.

bfdIpv4Endpoints.description: The IPv4 addresses of the endpoints to send BFD probes to.

dnsAddresses.description: The DNS servers to signal to UEs to use for this attached data network. This configuration is mandatory - if you don't want DNS servers, you must provide an empty array.

naptConfiguration.description:
The network address and port translation (NAPT) configuration.
If this is not specified, the attached data network will use a default NAPT configuration with NAPT enabled.

enabled.description: Whether NAPT is enabled for connections to this attached data network.

values.description: NAPT is enabled
NAPT is disabled

portRange.description:
Range of port numbers to use as translated ports on each translated address.
If not specified and NAPT is enabled, this range defaults to 1,024 - 49,999.
(Ports under 1,024 should not be used because these are special purpose ports reserved by IANA. Ports 50,000 and above are reserved for non-NAPT use.)

portReuseHoldTime.description: The minimum time (in seconds) that will pass before a port that was used by a closed pinhole can be recycled for use by another pinhole. All hold times must be at least 1 second.

tcp.description: Minimum time in seconds that will pass before a TCP port that was used by a closed pinhole can be reused. Default for TCP is 2 minutes.

udp.description: Minimum time in seconds that will pass before a UDP port that was used by a closed pinhole can be reused. Default for UDP is 1 minute.

pinholeLimits.description: Maximum number of UDP and TCP pinholes that can be open simultaneously on the core interface. For 5G networks, this is the N6 interface. For 4G networks, this is the SGi interface.

pinholeTimeouts.description: Expiry times of inactive NAPT pinholes, in seconds. All timers must be at least 1 second.

tcp.description: Pinhole timeout for TCP pinholes in seconds. Default for TCP is 3 minutes.

udp.description: Pinhole timeout for UDP pinholes in seconds. Default for UDP is 30 seconds.

icmp.description: Pinhole timeout for ICMP pinholes in seconds. Default for ICMP Echo is 30 seconds.

userEquipmentAddressPoolPrefix.description:
The user equipment (UE) address pool prefixes for the attached data network from which the packet core instance will dynamically assign IP addresses to UEs.
The packet core instance assigns an IP address to a UE when the UE sets up a PDU session.
 You must define at least one of userEquipmentAddressPoolPrefix and userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix. If you define both, they must be of the same size.

userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix.description:
The user equipment (UE) address pool prefixes for the attached data network from which the packet core instance will assign static IP addresses to UEs.
The packet core instance assigns an IP address to a UE when the UE sets up a PDU session. The static IP address for a specific UE is set in StaticIPConfiguration on the corresponding SIM resource.
At least one of userEquipmentAddressPoolPrefix and userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix must be defined. If both are defined, they must be of the same size.

version.description: The desired version of the packet core software.

installedVersion.description: The currently installed version of the packet core software.

rollbackVersion.description: The previous version of the packet core software that was deployed. Used when performing the rollback action.

controlPlaneAccessInterface.description: The control plane interface on the access network. For 5G networks, this is the N2 interface. For 4G networks, this is the S1-MME interface.

name.description: The logical name for this interface. This should match one of the interfaces configured on your Azure Stack Edge device.

vlanId.description: VLAN identifier of the network interface. Example: 501.

ipv4AddressList.description: The list of IPv4 addresses, for a multi-node system.

bfdIpv4Endpoints.description: The IPv4 addresses of the endpoints to send BFD probes to.

controlPlaneAccessVirtualIpv4Addresses.description: The virtual IP address(es) for the control plane on the access network in a High Availability (HA) system. In an HA deployment the access network router should be configured to anycast traffic for this address to the control plane access interfaces on the active and standby nodes. In non-HA system this list should be omitted or empty.

sku.description: The SKU defining the throughput and SIM allowances for this packet core control plane deployment.

values.description: 100 Mbps, 20 active SIMs plan, 2 RANs
1 Gbps, 100 active SIMs plan, 5 RANs
2 Gbps, 200 active SIMs plan, 10 RANs
5 Gbps, 500 active SIMs plan
10 Gbps, 1000 active SIMs plan

ueMtu.description: The MTU (in bytes) signaled to the UE. The same MTU is set on the user plane data links for all data networks. The MTU set on the user plane access link is calculated to be 60 bytes greater than this value to allow for GTP encapsulation.

localDiagnosticsAccess.description: The kubernetes ingress configuration to control access to packet core diagnostics over local APIs.

authenticationType.description: How to authenticate users who access local diagnostics APIs.

values.description: Use AAD SSO to authenticate the user (this requires internet access).
Use locally stored passwords to authenticate the user.

httpsServerCertificate.description: The HTTPS server TLS certificate used to secure local access to diagnostics.

certificateUrl.description: The certificate URL, unversioned. For example: https://contosovault.vault.azure.net/certificates/ingress.

provisioning.description: The provisioning state of the certificate.

values.description: The certificate has not been provisioned.
The certificate has been provisioned.
The certificate failed to be provisioned. The "reason" property explains why.

reason.description: Reason for certificate provisioning failure.

diagnosticsUpload.description: Configuration for uploading packet core diagnostics

storageAccountContainerUrl.description: The Storage Account Container URL to upload diagnostics to.

eventHub.description: Configuration for sending packet core events to an Azure Event Hub.

id.description: Resource ID  of Azure Event Hub to send packet core events to.

reportingInterval.description: The duration (in seconds) between UE usage reports.

signaling.description: Signaling configuration for the packet core.

macroMmeGroupId.description: The macro network's MME group ID. This is where unknown UEs are sent to via NAS reroute.

values.description: NAS signaling is not encrypted.
NAS signaling is encrypted with SNOW 3G cipher.
NAS signaling is encrypted with AES cipher.

nasEncryption.description: An ordered list of NAS encryption algorithms, used to encrypt control plane traffic between the UE and packet core, in order from most to least preferred. If not specified, the packet core will use a built-in default ordering.

interopSettings.description: Settings to allow interoperability with third party components e.g. RANs and UEs.

homeNetworkPrivateKeysProvisioning.description: The provisioning state of the secret containing private keys and keyIds for SUPI concealment.

state.description: The provisioning state of the private keys for SUPI concealment.

values.description: Provisioning of the private keys for SUPI concealment has not been attempted.
The private keys for SUPI concealment are successfully provisioned.
Provisioning of the private keys for SUPI concealment has failed.

userConsent.description: The user consent configuration for the packet core.

allowSupportTelemetryAccess.description: Allow Microsoft to access non-PII telemetry information from the packet core.

identity.description: The identity used to retrieve the ingress certificate from Azure key vault.

type.description: Type of managed service identity (currently only UserAssigned allowed).

userAssignedIdentities.title: User-Assigned Identities
userAssignedIdentities.description: The set of user assigned identities associated with the resource. The userAssignedIdentities dictionary keys will be ARM resource ids in the form: '/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.ManagedIdentity/userAssignedIdentities/{identityName}. The dictionary values can be empty objects ({}) in requests.

principalId.description: The principal ID of the assigned identity.

clientId.description: The client ID of the assigned identity.

schema.description: Packet core control plane resource.

put.description: Creates or updates a packet core control plane.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: packetCoreControlPlaneName
parameters.description: The name of the packet core control plane.

parameters.name: parameters

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the packet core control plane resource.

installation.description: The installation state of the packet core control plane resource.

values.description: Don't install the packet core.
Install the packet core.
The packet core is uninstalled.
The packet core is installing.
The packet core is installed.
The packet core is updating its configuration.
The packet core is upgrading to a different software version.
The packet core is uninstalling.
The packet core is reinstalling.
The packet core is rolling back to its previous version.
The packet core is in failed state.

reinstallRequired.description: Whether a reinstall of the packet core is required to pick up the latest configuration changes.

values.description: A reinstall of the packet core is required.
A reinstall of the packet core is not required.

reasons.description: Reason(s) for the current installation state of the packet core.

items.description: The reason or list of reasons why a packet core has not been installed or requires a reinstall.

values.description: The packet core has not been installed as the mobile network does not have any applicable configured slices.
The packet core has not been installed as there is no configured data plane for this packet core.
The packet core has not been installed as the packet core has no attached data networks.
A reinstall is required as the packet core is running with out-of-date PLMN ID.
A reinstall is required as the packet core is running with out-of-date control plane access interface information.
A reinstall is required as the packet core is running with out-of-date user plane core interface.
A reinstall is required as the packet core is running with out-of-date user plane access interface.
A reinstall is required as the packet core is running with out-of-date control plane access network virtual IP address.
A reinstall is required as the packet core is running with out-of-date user plane access network virtual IP address.

In an HA deployment the access network router should be configured to forward traffic for this address to the control plane access interface on the active or standby node. In non-HA system this list should be omitted or empty.

userPlaneAccessInterface.description: The user plane interface on the access network. For 5G networks, this is the N3 interface. For 4G networks, this is the S1-U interface.

name.description: The logical name for this interface. This should match one of the interfaces configured on your Azure Stack Edge device.

vlanId.description: VLAN identifier of the network interface. Example: 501.

ipv4AddressList.description: The list of IPv4 addresses, for a multi-node system.

bfdIpv4Endpoints.description: The IPv4 addresses of the endpoints to send BFD probes to.

userPlaneAccessVirtualIpv4Addresses.description: The virtual IP address(es) for the user plane on the access network in a High Availability (HA) system. In an HA deployment the access network router should be configured to forward traffic for this address to the control plane access interface on the active or standby node. In non-HA system this list should be omitted or empty.

value.description: A list of packet core data planes in a resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the service resource.

servicePrecedence.description: A precedence value that is used to decide between services when identifying the QoS values to use for a particular SIM. A lower value means a higher priority. This value should be unique among all services configured in the mobile network.

serviceQosPolicy.description: The QoS policy to use for packets matching this service. This can be overridden for particular flows using the ruleQosPolicy field in a PccRuleConfiguration. If this field is null then the UE's SIM policy will define the QoS settings.

5qi.description: 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt
May preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot be preempted
May be preempted

maximumBitRate.description: The maximum bit rate (MBR) for all service data flows that use this data flow policy rule or service.

pccRules.description: The set of data flow policy rules that make up this service.

ruleName.description: The name of the rule. This must be unique within the parent service. You must not use any of the following reserved strings - `default`, `requested` or `service`.

rulePrecedence.description: A precedence value that is used to decide between data flow policy rules when identifying the QoS values to use for a particular SIM. A lower value means a higher priority. This value should be unique among all data flow policy rules configured in the mobile network.

ruleQosPolicy.description: The QoS policy to use for packets matching this rule. If this field is null then the parent service will define the QoS settings.

5qi.description: 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt
May preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot be preempted
May be preempted

maximumBitRate.description: The maximum bit rate (MBR) for all service data flows that use this data flow policy rule or service.

guaranteedBitRate.description: The guaranteed bit rate (GBR) for all service data flows that use this data flow policy rule. This is an optional setting. If you do not provide a value, there will be no GBR set for the data flow policy rule that uses this QoS definition.

trafficControl.description: Determines whether flows that match this data flow policy rule are permitted.

values.description: Traffic matching this rule is allowed to flow.
Traffic matching this rule is not allowed to flow.

serviceDataFlowTemplates.description: The set of data flow templates to use for this data flow policy rule.

templateName.description: The name of the data flow template. This must be unique within the parent data flow policy rule. You must not use any of the following reserved strings - `default`, `requested` or `service`.

values.description: Traffic flowing from the UE to the data network.
Traffic flowing from the data network to the UE.
Traffic flowing both to and from the UE.

protocol.description: A list of the allowed protocol(s) for this flow. If you want this flow to be able to use any protocol within the internet protocol suite, use the value `ip`. If you only want to allow a selection of protocols, you must use the corresponding IANA Assigned Internet Protocol Number for each protocol, as described in https://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/protocol-numbers.xhtml. For example, for UDP, you must use 17. If you use the value `ip` then you must leave the field `port` unspecified.

remoteIpList.description: The remote IP address(es) to which UEs will connect for this flow. If you want to allow connections on any IP address, use the value `any`. Otherwise, you must provide each of the remote IP addresses to which the packet core instance will connect for this flow. You must provide each IP address in CIDR notation, including the netmask (for example, 192.0.2.54/24).

ports.description: The port(s) to which UEs will connect for this flow. You can specify zero or more ports or port ranges. If you specify one or more ports or port ranges then you must specify a value other than `ip` in the `protocol` field. This is an optional setting. If you do not specify it then connections will be allowed on all ports. Port ranges must be specified as <FirstPort>-<LastPort>. For example: [`8080`, `8082-8085`].

Traffic matching this rule is not allowed to flow.

serviceDataFlowTemplates.description: The set of data flow templates to use for this data flow policy rule.

templateName.description: The name of the data flow template. This must be unique within the parent data flow policy rule. You must not use any of the following reserved strings - `default`, `requested` or `service`.

values.description: Traffic flowing from the UE to the data network.
Traffic flowing from the data network to the UE.
Traffic flowing both to and from the UE.

protocol.description: A list of the allowed protocol(s) for this flow. If you want this flow to be able to use any protocol within the internet protocol suite, use the value `ip`. If you only want to allow a selection of protocols, you must use the corresponding IANA Assigned Internet Protocol Number for each protocol, as described in https://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/protocol-numbers.xhtml. For example, for UDP, you must use 17. If you use the value `ip` then you must leave the field `port` unspecified.

remoteIpList.description: The remote IP address(es) to which UEs will connect for this flow. If you want to allow connections on any IP address, use the value `any`. Otherwise, you must provide each of the remote IP addresses to which the packet core instance will connect for this flow. You must provide each IP address in CIDR notation, including the netmask (for example, 192.0.2.54/24).

ports.description: The port(s) to which UEs will connect for this flow. You can specify zero or more ports or port ranges. If you specify one or more ports or port ranges then you must specify a value other than `ip` in the `protocol` field. This is an optional setting. If you do not specify it then connections will be allowed on all ports. Port ranges must be specified as <FirstPort>-<LastPort>. For example: [`8080`, `8082-8085`].

servicePrecedence.description: A precedence value that is used to decide between services when identifying the QoS values to use for a particular SIM. A lower value means a higher priority. This value should be unique among all services configured in the mobile network.

serviceQosPolicy.description: The QoS policy to use for packets matching this service. This can be overridden for particular flows using the ruleQosPolicy field in a PccRuleConfiguration. If this field is null then the UE's SIM policy will define the QoS settings.

5qi.description: 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt
May preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot be preempted
May be preempted

integratedCircuitCardIdentifier.description: The integrated circuit card ID (ICCID) for the SIM.

slice.description: The network slice on which the static IP address will be used. The combination of attached data network and slice defines the network scope of the IP address. The slice must be in the same location as the SIM.

staticIp.description: The static IP configuration for the SIM to use at the defined network scope.

ipv4Address.description: The IPv4 address assigned to the SIM at this network scope. This address must be in the userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix defined in the attached data network.

staticIpConfiguration.description: A list of static IP addresses assigned to this SIM. Each address is assigned at a defined network scope, made up of {attached data network, slice}.

vendorName.description: The name of the SIM vendor who provided this SIM, if any.

vendorKeyFingerprint.description: The public key fingerprint of the SIM vendor who provided this SIM, if any.

authenticationKey.description: The Ki value for the SIM.

operatorKeyCode.description: The Opc value for the SIM.

deviceType.description: An optional free-form text field that can be used to record the device type this SIM is associated with, for example 'Video camera'. The Azure portal allows SIMs to be grouped and filtered based on this value.

simPolicy.description: The SIM policy used by this SIM. The SIM policy must be in the same location as the SIM.

id.description: SIM policy resource ID.

items.description: Static IP configuration for a SIM, scoped to a particular attached data network and slice.

attachedDataNetwork.description: The attached data network on which the static IP address will be used. The combination of attached data network and slice defines the network scope of the IP address. The attached data network must be in the same location as the SIM.

id.description: Attached data network resource ID.

slice.description: The network slice on which the static IP address will be used. The combination of attached data network and slice defines the network scope of the IP address. The slice must be in the same location as the SIM.

id.description: Slice resource ID.

staticIp.description: The static IP configuration for the SIM to use at the defined network scope.

ipv4Address.description: The IPv4 address assigned to the SIM at this network scope. This address must be in the userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix defined in the attached data network.

staticIpConfiguration.description: A list of static IP addresses assigned to this SIM. Each address is assigned at a defined network scope, made up of {attached data network, slice}.

vendorName.description: The name of the SIM vendor who provided this SIM, if any.

vendorKeyFingerprint.description: The public key fingerprint of the SIM vendor who provided this SIM, if any.

authenticationKey.description: The Ki value for the SIM.

operatorKeyCode.description: The Opc value for the SIM.

schema.description: SIM resource.

defaultSlice.description: The default slice to use if the UE does not explicitly specify it. This slice must exist in the `sliceConfigurations` map. The slice must be in the same location as the SIM policy.

rfspIndex.description: RAT/Frequency Selection Priority Index, defined in 3GPP TS 36.413. This is an optional setting and by default is unspecified.

registrationTimer.description: UE periodic registration update timer (5G) or UE periodic tracking area update timer (4G), in seconds.

sliceConfigurations.description: The allowed slices and the settings to use for them. The list must not contain duplicate items and must contain at least one item.

dataNetworkConfigurations.description: The allowed data networks and the settings to use for them. The list must not contain duplicate items and must contain at least one item.

id.description: Data network resource ID.

sessionAmbr.description: Aggregate maximum bit rate across all non-GBR QoS flows of a given PDU session. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.6 for a full description of the Session-AMBR.

5qi.description: Default 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: Default QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: Default QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt
May preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: Default QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot be preempted
May be preempted

defaultSessionType.description: The default PDU session type, which is used if the UE does not request a specific session type.

additionalAllowedSessionTypes.description: Allowed session types in addition to the default session type. Must not duplicate the default session type.

allowedServices.description: List of services that can be used as part of this SIM policy. The list must not contain duplicate items and must contain at least one item. The services must be in the same location as the SIM policy.

id.description: Service resource ID.

maximumNumberOfBufferedPackets.description: The maximum number of downlink packets to buffer at the user plane for High Latency Communication - Extended Buffering. See 3GPP TS29.272 v15.10.0 section 7.3.188 for a full description. This maximum is not guaranteed because there is a internal limit on buffered packets across all PDU sessions.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group. The name is case insensitive.

parameters.name: mobileNetworkName
parameters.description: The name of the mobile network.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: The ID of the target subscription. The value must be an UUID.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of SIM policy resources.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the SIM policy resource.

siteProvisioningState.description: A dictionary of sites to the provisioning state of this SIM policy on that site.

additionalProperties.description: The provisioning state of a resource e.g. SIM/SIM policy on a site.

values.description: The resource should not be provisioned on this site.
The resource is being added to this site.
The resource is being updated on this site.
The resource is being deleted from this site.
The resource is provisioned on this site.
The resource failed to be provisioned on this site.

ueAmbr.description: Aggregate maximum bit rate across all non-GBR QoS flows of all PDU sessions of a given UE. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.6 for a full description of the UE-AMBR.

defaultSlice.description: The default slice to use if the UE does not explicitly specify it. This slice must exist in the `sliceConfigurations` map. The slice must be in the same location as the SIM policy.

id.description: Slice resource ID.

rfspIndex.description: RAT/Frequency Selection Priority Index, defined in 3GPP TS 36.413. This is an optional setting and by default is unspecified.

registrationTimer.description: UE periodic registration update timer (5G) or UE periodic tracking area update timer (4G), in seconds.

sliceConfigurations.description: The allowed slices and the settings to use for them. The list must not contain duplicate items and must contain at least one item.

slice.description: A reference to the slice that these settings apply to. The slice must be in the same location as the SIM policy.

id.description: Slice resource ID.

defaultDataNetwork.description: The default data network to use if the UE does not explicitly specify it. Configuration for this object must exist in the `dataNetworkConfigurations` map. The data network must be in the same location as the SIM policy.

id.description: Data network resource ID.

dataNetworkConfigurations.description: The allowed data networks and the settings to use for them. The list must not contain duplicate items and must contain at least one item.

dataNetwork.description: A reference to the data network that these settings apply to. The data network must be in the same location as the SIM policy.

id.description: Data network resource ID.

sessionAmbr.description: Aggregate maximum bit rate across all non-GBR QoS flows of a given PDU session. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.6 for a full description of the Session-AMBR.

5qi.description: Default 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: Default QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: Default QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt
May preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: Default QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot be preempted
May be preempted

defaultSessionType.description: The default PDU session type, which is used if the UE does not request a specific session type.

additionalAllowedSessionTypes.description: Allowed session types in addition to the default session type. Must not duplicate the default session type.

allowedServices.description: List of services that can be used as part of this SIM policy. The list must not contain duplicate items and must contain at least one item. The services must be in the same location as the SIM policy.

id.description: Service resource ID.

maximumNumberOfBufferedPackets.description: The maximum number of downlink packets to buffer at the user plane for High Latency Communication - Extended Buffering. See 3GPP TS29.272 v15.10.0 section 7.3.188 for a full description. This maximum is not guaranteed because there is a internal limit on buffered packets across all PDU sessions.

value.description: A list of SIM policies.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

schema.description: Response for SIM policies API service call.

delete.description: Deletes the specified mobile network site. This will also delete any network functions that are a part of this site.

parameters.description: The API version to use for this operation.

parameters.name: siteName
parameters.description: The name of the mobile network site.

200.description: Delete successful.

202.description: Accepted. Sets 'Deleting' provisioningState until the operation completes. Returns an operation URI that can be queried to find the current state of the operation.

userPlaneDataInterface.description: The user plane interface on the data network. For 5G networks, this is the N6 interface. For 4G networks, this is the SGi interface.

name.description: The logical name for this interface. This should match one of the interfaces configured on your Azure Stack Edge device.

vlanId.description: VLAN identifier of the network interface. Example: 501.

ipv4AddressList.description: The list of IPv4 addresses, for a multi-node system.

bfdIpv4Endpoints.description: The IPv4 addresses of the endpoints to send BFD probes to.

dnsAddresses.description: The DNS servers to signal to UEs to use for this attached data network. This configuration is mandatory - if you don't want DNS servers, you must provide an empty array.

naptConfiguration.description:
The network address and port translation (NAPT) configuration.
If this is not specified, the attached data network will use a default NAPT configuration with NAPT enabled.

enabled.description: Whether NAPT is enabled for connections to this attached data network.

values.description: NAPT is enabled
NAPT is disabled

portRange.description:
Range of port numbers to use as translated ports on each translated address.
If not specified and NAPT is enabled, this range defaults to 1,024 - 49,999.
(Ports under 1,024 should not be used because these are special purpose ports reserved by IANA. Ports 50,000 and above are reserved for non-NAPT use.)

portReuseHoldTime.description: The minimum time (in seconds) that will pass before a port that was used by a closed pinhole can be recycled for use by another pinhole. All hold times must be at least 1 second.

tcp.description: Minimum time in seconds that will pass before a TCP port that was used by a closed pinhole can be reused. Default for TCP is 2 minutes.

udp.description: Minimum time in seconds that will pass before a UDP port that was used by a closed pinhole can be reused. Default for UDP is 1 minute.

pinholeLimits.description: Maximum number of UDP and TCP pinholes that can be open simultaneously on the core interface. For 5G networks, this is the N6 interface. For 4G networks, this is the SGi interface.

pinholeTimeouts.description: Expiry times of inactive NAPT pinholes, in seconds. All timers must be at least 1 second.

tcp.description: Pinhole timeout for TCP pinholes in seconds. Default for TCP is 3 minutes.

udp.description: Pinhole timeout for UDP pinholes in seconds. Default for UDP is 30 seconds.

icmp.description: Pinhole timeout for ICMP pinholes in seconds. Default for ICMP Echo is 30 seconds.

userEquipmentAddressPoolPrefix.description:
The user equipment (UE) address pool prefixes for the attached data network from which the packet core instance will dynamically assign IP addresses to UEs.
The packet core instance assigns an IP address to a UE when the UE sets up a PDU session.
 You must define at least one of userEquipmentAddressPoolPrefix and userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix. If you define both, they must be of the same size.

userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix.description:
The user equipment (UE) address pool prefixes for the attached data network from which the packet core instance will assign static IP addresses to UEs.
The packet core instance assigns an IP address to a UE when the UE sets up a PDU session. The static IP address for a specific UE is set in StaticIPConfiguration on the corresponding SIM resource.
At least one of userEquipmentAddressPoolPrefix and userEquipmentStaticAddressPoolPrefix must be defined. If both are defined, they must be of the same size.

sites.description: Site(s) under which this packet core control plane should be deployed. The sites must be in the same location as the packet core control plane.

platform.description: The platform where the packet core is deployed.

type.description: The platform type where packet core is deployed.

values.description: If this option is chosen, you must set one of "azureStackEdgeDevice", "connectedCluster" or "customLocation". If multiple are set, they must be consistent with each other.
If this option is chosen, you must set one of "azureStackHciCluster", "connectedCluster" or "customLocation". If multiple are set, they must be consistent with each other.

azureStackEdgeDevice.description: The Azure Stack Edge device where the packet core is deployed. If the device is part of a fault tolerant pair, either device in the pair can be specified.

id.description: Azure Stack Edge device resource ID.
Azure Stack Edge device resource ID.

items.description: Reference to an Azure Stack Edge device resource.

azureStackEdgeDevices.description: The Azure Stack Edge devices where the packet core is deployed. If the packet core is deployed across multiple devices, all devices will appear in this list.

azureStackHciCluster.description: The Azure Stack HCI cluster where the packet core is deployed.

id.description: Azure Stack HCI cluster resource ID.

connectedCluster.description: Azure Arc connected cluster where the packet core is deployed.

customLocation.description: Azure Arc custom location where the packet core is deployed.

id.description: Azure Arc custom location resource ID.

coreNetworkTechnology.description: The core network technology generation (5G core or EPC / 4G core).

values.description: 5G core
EPC / 4G core
Combined EPC / 4G and 5G core

version.description: The desired version of the packet core software.

installedVersion.description: The currently installed version of the packet core software.

rollbackVersion.description: The previous version of the packet core software that was deployed. Used when performing the rollback action.

controlPlaneAccessInterface.description: The control plane interface on the access network. For 5G networks, this is the N2 interface. For 4G networks, this is the S1-MME interface.

name.description: The logical name for this interface. This should match one of the interfaces configured on your Azure Stack Edge device.

vlanId.description: VLAN identifier of the network interface. Example: 501.

ipv4AddressList.description: The list of IPv4 addresses, for a multi-node system.

bfdIpv4Endpoints.description: The IPv4 addresses of the endpoints to send BFD probes to.

controlPlaneAccessVirtualIpv4Addresses.description: The virtual IP address(es) for the control plane on the access network in a High Availability (HA) system. In an HA deployment the access network router should be configured to anycast traffic for this address to the control plane access interfaces on the active and standby nodes. In non-HA system this list should be omitted or empty.

sku.description: The SKU defining the throughput and SIM allowances for this packet core control plane deployment.

values.description: 100 Mbps, 20 active SIMs plan, 2 RANs
1 Gbps, 100 active SIMs plan, 5 RANs
2 Gbps, 200 active SIMs plan, 10 RANs
5 Gbps, 500 active SIMs plan
10 Gbps, 1000 active SIMs plan

ueMtu.description: The MTU (in bytes) signaled to the UE. The same MTU is set on the user plane data links for all data networks. The MTU set on the user plane access link is calculated to be 60 bytes greater than this value to allow for GTP encapsulation.

localDiagnosticsAccess.description: The kubernetes ingress configuration to control access to packet core diagnostics over local APIs.

authenticationType.description: How to authenticate users who access local diagnostics APIs.

values.description: Use AAD SSO to authenticate the user (this requires internet access).
Use locally stored passwords to authenticate the user.

httpsServerCertificate.description: The HTTPS server TLS certificate used to secure local access to diagnostics.

certificateUrl.description: The certificate URL, unversioned. For example: https://contosovault.vault.azure.net/certificates/ingress.

provisioning.description: The provisioning state of the certificate.

values.description: The certificate has not been provisioned.
The certificate has been provisioned.
The certificate failed to be provisioned. The "reason" property explains why.

reason.description: Reason for certificate provisioning failure.

diagnosticsUpload.description: Configuration for uploading packet core diagnostics

storageAccountContainerUrl.description: The Storage Account Container URL to upload diagnostics to.

eventHub.description: Configuration for sending packet core events to an Azure Event Hub.

id.description: Resource ID  of Azure Event Hub to send packet core events to.

reportingInterval.description: The duration (in seconds) between UE usage reports.

signaling.description: Signaling configuration for the packet core.

macroMmeGroupId.description: The macro network's MME group ID. This is where unknown UEs are sent to via NAS reroute.

values.description: NAS signaling is not encrypted.
NAS signaling is encrypted with SNOW 3G cipher.
NAS signaling is encrypted with AES cipher.

nasEncryption.description: An ordered list of NAS encryption algorithms, used to encrypt control plane traffic between the UE and packet core, in order from most to least preferred. If not specified, the packet core will use a built-in default ordering.

interopSettings.description: Settings to allow interoperability with third party components e.g. RANs and UEs.

In non-HA system this list should be omitted or empty.

items.description: Packet core data plane resource. Must be created in the same location as its parent packet core control plane.

value.description: A list of packet core data planes in a resource group.

nextLink.description: The URL to get the next set of results.

PacketCoreDataPlaneListResult.description: Response for packet core data planes API service call.

id.description: Fully qualified resource ID for the resource. E.g. "/subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/{resourceProviderNamespace}/{resourceType}/{resourceName}"

type.description: The type of the resource. E.g. "Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines" or "Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts"

systemData.description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

createdBy.description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the service resource.

servicePrecedence.description: A precedence value that is used to decide between services when identifying the QoS values to use for a particular SIM. A lower value means a higher priority. This value should be unique among all services configured in the mobile network.

serviceQosPolicy.description: The QoS policy to use for packets matching this service. This can be overridden for particular flows using the ruleQosPolicy field in a PccRuleConfiguration. If this field is null then the UE's SIM policy will define the QoS settings.

5qi.description: 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt
May preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot be preempted
May be preempted

maximumBitRate.description: The maximum bit rate (MBR) for all service data flows that use this data flow policy rule or service.

pccRules.description: The set of data flow policy rules that make up this service.

ruleName.description: The name of the rule. This must be unique within the parent service. You must not use any of the following reserved strings - `default`, `requested` or `service`.

rulePrecedence.description: A precedence value that is used to decide between data flow policy rules when identifying the QoS values to use for a particular SIM. A lower value means a higher priority. This value should be unique among all data flow policy rules configured in the mobile network.

ruleQosPolicy.description: The QoS policy to use for packets matching this rule. If this field is null then the parent service will define the QoS settings.

5qi.description: 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

maximumBitRate.description: The maximum bit rate (MBR) for all service data flows that use this data flow policy rule or service.

guaranteedBitRate.description: The guaranteed bit rate (GBR) for all service data flows that use this data flow policy rule. This is an optional setting. If you do not provide a value, there will be no GBR set for the data flow policy rule that uses this QoS definition.

trafficControl.description: Determines whether flows that match this data flow policy rule are permitted.

values.description: Traffic matching this rule is allowed to flow.
Traffic matching this rule is not allowed to flow.

serviceDataFlowTemplates.description: The set of data flow templates to use for this data flow policy rule.

templateName.description: The name of the data flow template. This must be unique within the parent data flow policy rule. You must not use any of the following reserved strings - `default`, `requested` or `service`.

values.description: Traffic flowing from the UE to the data network.
Traffic flowing from the data network to the UE.
Traffic flowing both to and from the UE.

protocol.description: A list of the allowed protocol(s) for this flow. If you want this flow to be able to use any protocol within the internet protocol suite, use the value `ip`. If you only want to allow a selection of protocols, you must use the corresponding IANA Assigned Internet Protocol Number for each protocol, as described in https://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/protocol-numbers.xhtml. For example, for UDP, you must use 17. If you use the value `ip` then you must leave the field `port` unspecified.

remoteIpList.description: The remote IP address(es) to which UEs will connect for this flow. If you want to allow connections on any IP address, use the value `any`. Otherwise, you must provide each of the remote IP addresses to which the packet core instance will connect for this flow. You must provide each IP address in CIDR notation, including the netmask (for example, 192.0.2.54/24).

ports.description: The port(s) to which UEs will connect for this flow. You can specify zero or more ports or port ranges. If you specify one or more ports or port ranges then you must specify a value other than `ip` in the `protocol` field. This is an optional setting. If you do not specify it then connections will be allowed on all ports. Port ranges must be specified as <FirstPort>-<LastPort>. For example: [`8080`, `8082-8085`].

sessionAmbr.description: Aggregate maximum bit rate across all non-GBR QoS flows of a given PDU session. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.6 for a full description of the Session-AMBR.

5qi.description: Default 5G QoS Flow Indicator value. The 5QI identifies a specific QoS forwarding treatment to be provided to a flow. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.1 for a full description of the 5QI parameter, and table 5.7.4-1 for the definition the 5QI values.

allocationAndRetentionPriorityLevel.description: Default QoS Flow allocation and retention priority (ARP) level. Flows with higher priority preempt flows with lower priority, if the settings of `preemptionCapability` and `preemptionVulnerability` allow it. 1 is the highest level of priority. If this field is not specified then `5qi` is used to derive the ARP value. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

preemptionCapability.description: Default QoS Flow preemption capability. The preemption capability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can preempt another QoS Flow with a lower priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot preempt
May preempt

preemptionVulnerability.description: Default QoS Flow preemption vulnerability. The preemption vulnerability of a QoS Flow controls whether it can be preempted by a QoS Flow with a higher priority level. See 3GPP TS23.501 section 5.7.2.2 for a full description of the ARP parameters.

values.description: Cannot be preempted
May be preempted

The values 001-01 and 001-001 can be used for testing and the values 999-99 and 999-999 can be used on internal private networks.

lastActivityTime.description: The timestamp of last activity of UE (UTC).
